oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quarterly return of ordnance and ordnance stores received, issued, and remaining on hand, Company K, 5th Regiment, Tennessee Volunteer Cavalry
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military weapons -- United States ; Robinson, Wingate Truitt, 1832-1903 ; United States. Army. Tennessee Cavalry Regiment, 5th (1862-1865); Arms and armament; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The original and duplicate returns, the letter of transmittal, and all papers connected with them, were to be sent to the Chief of Ordnance in one package [Form No. 1 - (b.) For the use of Cavalry.].
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Ordnance Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Class VI consisted of small arms, rifles or carbines, pistols, and sabres. Class VII included accoutrements, equipment, and appendages for carbines or rifles; pistols; sabres: aquipment (listed as serviceable or unserviceable).
